import Mathlib

/-!
Let E be a finite-dimensional normed real vector space (for example E = â„^n).
Let f : E â†’ â„ be C^2 on a convex set U âŠ† E, and assume the Hessian (the iterated
FrÃ©chet derivative of order 2) of f is continuous on U. Then the remainder in the
Taylor approximation of order 2 is o(â€–hâ€–^2) uniformly on compact subsets of U.

The statement below expresses the uniform little-o property in Îµ-Î´ form on compact
subsets K âŠ† U.  The proof is omitted (``:= by sorry'').
-/

open Set Metric

theorem taylor_remainder_order_two_uniform_small_o {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E]
  [NormedSpace â„ E] [FiniteDimensional â„ E]
  {f : E â†’ â„} {U : Set E}
  (hU : Convex U)
  (hC2 : ContDiffOn â„ 2 f U)
  (hHess_cont : ContinuousOn (fun x => iteratedFDeriv â„ 2 f x) U) :
  âˆ€ (K : Set E), IsCompact K â†’ K âŠ† U â†’
    âˆ€ (Îµ : â„), Îµ > 0 â†’ âˆƒ (Î´ : â„), Î´ > 0 âˆ§
      âˆ€ (x : E) (hx : x âˆˆ K) (h : E), â€–hâ€– < Î´ â†’
        abs (f (x + h) - f x - (fderiv â„ f x : E â†’L[â„] â„) h - (1 / 2) * (iteratedFDeriv â„ 2 f x) (h, h)) â‰¤ Îµ * â€–hâ€– ^ 2 :=
